meanings.definition: To fill or impregnate with venom; to poison; to make venomous.
meanings.sent1: The wicked witch envenomed the apple to harm Snow White.
meanings.sent2: The snake envenomed its prey with a deadly bite.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat envenomed the milk to play a prank on the unsuspecting dog.
meanings.sent4: His words were envenomed with spite, causing discord among friends.
meanings.sent5: The envenomed spider injected its venom into the intruder, causing a painful reaction.

meanings.sent1: The bitter argument envenomed their relationship.
meanings.sent2: The negative comments envenomed the atmosphere of the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The spoiled food envenomed the picnic, leaving everyone disappointed.
meanings.sent4: The betrayal envenomed her trust in others.
meanings.sent5: The harsh criticism envenomed his feelings, leading to a sense of resentment.
